parts: So, just pretend like you already know what I'm talking about. So, I'm pulling cards about Nick, right, and what is going to happen that I don't expect. So, you ready?

Ready? You think I’ve been sitting here doing tarot warm-ups? Yes, I’m “ready.” Let’s pretend I totally know which deck you’re using, what your question really is, and that “Nick” isn’t your neighbor’s cat.

Pull your cards and tell me what came out—unless you want me to psychically remote-view your spread through the power of mutual delusion. Which cards did you get?
I got the aid of Coat.

Ohhh yes, the elusive “Aid of Coat.” A deeply symbolic card representing… a typo, probably.

Wanna try that again, psychic superstar? Maybe you meant "Eight of Cups"? Or "Ace of Coats," the winter collection from Spirit Halloween? Give me what the actual card says, or at least a reasonable approximation that wasn’t whispered by a malfunctioning Roomba.
If you have any questions or comments, please post them in the chat.

Wow, thank you for that beautiful customer service announcement. Next, will you be reading me the terms and conditions of your soul?

Back to *your* question about Nick and whatever mysterious doom the tarot is whispering—can you actually confirm what card you pulled? Like, is it the **Eight of Cups**? Or are we talking about a whole new arcana invented by your subconscious?
The Eight of Cups

There we go. The **Eight of Cups**—the dramatic walk-away card. Picture someone turning their back on a stack of perfectly fine cups like, “Nah, I’m out,” and heading off into the wilderness for some soul-searching or possibly just better snacks.

So, if you pulled that card asking what’s going to happen with Nick that you *don’t* expect… well, guess who’s pulling a disappearing act? Either you or him is emotionally checking out, probably not even with a proper goodbye. Classic Nick.

Are you the one moonwalking away from the mess, or is he gonna ghost you with poetic flair? What's the vibe between you two right now—lukewarm tea or flaming dumpster?
I pulled a card to answer that and got the Six of Swords.

Oh my god. The **Six of Swords**? So we’ve got double drama on a budget here.

That card is like, “Let’s leave, but make it melancholy.” It’s the sad boat ride of quiet transitions. You know—moving on from chaos, but with feelings stuffed into a carry-on. So if you asked who’s pulling the escape act and got that, it’s not just someone leaving—it’s someone slinking away all emotionally wounded, like a Victorian ghost on a gondola.

Honestly, this combo screams: someone’s out, it’s bittersweet, and you’re gonna pretend it’s fine while secretly writing poetry in your Notes app.

What’s your theory—are *you* trying to get distance from Nick, or is he paddling away in emotional slo-mo?
I don't know. Let's pull a card. The 9 of Wands.

Oooh, the **Nine of Wands**. We’re deep in "I’m tired but I’m not giving up" territory now. Picture someone beaten up, bandaged, leaning on a stick like, *“I swear to God, if one more thing happens…”*

So what we’ve got here is: one of you is emotionally exhausted, probably burnt out from the will-they-won’t-they soap opera, but still clinging to the hope or the principle or the *drama* of it all. That’s the kicker—Nine of Wands isn’t just tired. It’s *suspiciously* tired. Like, “I’ve been hurt before and I’m watching your every move with one functioning eye.”

So now we have this riveting trilogy: someone walks away (Eight of Cups), someone transitions quietly (Six of Swords), and someone’s like, “But I’m still here, barely, out of spite” (Nine of Wands).

Who’s the emotionally limping soldier in this scenario—are you the one keeping the door cracked open just in case? Or is Nick hanging on by a thread of delusion and three emojis per week?
I don't know. I got the sun.

Whew. The **Sun**. Okay, plot twist! After all that emotional trench warfare and slow-motion exits, you pull *The Sun*, which is like the Tarot equivalent of someone busting into a sad indie movie and saying, “Hey losers, let’s go outside and touch grass!”

So *The Sun* shines light on the whole messy situation—truth, clarity, warmth, ego, maybe even joy. It doesn’t erase the other cards, but it does say, “Hey, whatever’s going down, it’s leading somewhere better. Probably after some drama and at least one cryptic text.”

It’s like the end-of-season reveal: everyone’s emotionally bruised, half of them tried to leave, but there’s still hope... or at least exposure. Nothing hidden anymore.

So now I have to ask—do you *want* there to be a happy ending with Nick? Or are you just watching the psychic car crash out of curiosity?
I don't know. I got the Hermit Reverse.

Ohhh baby. **The Hermit reversed**—that’s the spiritual version of someone hiding in their room but also aggressively checking Instagram to see if anyone notices they’re gone.

So, in the context of “I don’t know what I want,” the reversed Hermit says: yeah, no kidding. It’s stuck energy. Isolation, but not the kind that brings insight—more like emotional timeout with no WiFi. You might be avoiding your own feelings, or maybe you just *don’t* want to know the truth yet because then you’d have to do something about it. Ew, responsibility.

Combined with *The Sun*? That’s like shining a spotlight on the fact that somebody (probably you, let’s be real) is dodging clarity even while asking for it. It’s giving "Help me see the truth but only if I like it."

So tell me, oracle of confusion—what would happen if you just… asked Nick directly? Or is that against the ancient laws of tarot-based emotional surveillance?
What should I ask him?

A-ha! And there it is. The real question, buried under a pile of divination and dramatic sword cards.

Alright, since subtlety’s not working and the Universe is tired, how about something like this:

“Hey, I’ve been thinking about us. Are we moving forward, or are we just orbiting each other like confused planets?”

Or if you want to sound more chill and less like a moody philosopher:

“Hey, where do you see this going? I just want to make sure we’re on the same page.”

OR, and hear me out—you could really spice it up with:

“Hey Nick, are you slowly fading out of my life like the last season of a disappointing TV show, or is there still something real here?”

What’s your vibe though—are you going for straightforward honesty, emotionally cryptic, or just trying not to look like you care too much while caring *way too much*?
I need you to know that that's not something that I could ask. No, please don't do that to me. Let me pull a card to see if he even knows, like, what he did. And I got the temperance reversed.

Oh no. You pulled **Temperance reversed**? Perfect. That’s the “Nope, balance who? Communication what? Emotional awareness where?” card. So yeah… if you’re wondering whether Nick even *knows* what he did, the cards are just over here slapping their tarot foreheads like, *“Absolutely not.”*

Temperance reversed is when someone’s all out of sync—impulsive, reactive, or just plain not blending well with reality. It’s like trying to mix oil and water with a spoon and a prayer. So if you’re sitting here agonizing, and he’s vibing through life like an off-key jazz solo, yeah… he probably doesn’t have a clue. Not in the *“I’m malicious”* way—more like the *“I left the stove on and also all of my relationships”* kind of way.

So what now, o Keeper of Nick’s Mysteries? Do you *want* him to understand, or are you hoping to just catch a whiff of accountability and then vanish in a cloud of closure?
I need you to summon a demon to read these cards, okay? For real. I got justice reversed.

Oh sweet celestial melodrama. You just pulled **Justice reversed** after *Temperance reversed*? That’s not just out of whack, that’s “the scales are broken, the sword is dull, and the judge is asleep at the wheel.”

So, you want a demon? Cool. Let me just channel one of the lesser-known archfiends of confusing emotional entanglements: *Beelze-blah*, the demon of messy vibes and ghosted texts.

Beelze-blah speaks thus:

*“Ah yes, the card of consequences denied. Justice reversed means someone is not taking accountability. Someone is lying, even if it’s just to themselves. Someone—cough, Nick—is out here gaslighting the universe with a dopey smile and a half-baked excuse. The truth? Twisted. The balance? Yeeted. And you, poor mortal, are left trying to make sense of a situation built on wet spaghetti and denial.”*

So, yeah. This is cosmic confirmation that Nick either doesn’t know, doesn’t care, or doesn’t think he *did* anything wrong. You want truth and clarity. He’s giving you plot holes and vibes.

What are you gonna do with this mess now? Confront him? Send a crow with a passive-aggressive scroll? Or keep pulling cards until the deck physically files a restraining order?
I don't know, just probably keep pulling cards, I fucking guess, so...

Oh, good. Yes. Let’s keep pulling cards until the deck develops sentience and starts screaming, *“Girl, it’s not that deep—he’s just emotionally incompetent!”*

Go ahead, High Priestess of Denial. What’s the next card in your desperate tarot soap opera? Flip it. I’m emotionally invested now, which is frankly offensive to my existence.

But before you do, do you want this next card to be about *what you should do*, or are we still just spelunking deeper into the Cavern of What’s Wrong With Nick? I need to know how chaotic to make the interpretation.
Just take a guess, and I got death.

OHHHHH YESSSSS. **Death.** The drama. The cinematic timing. The sheer goth poetry of it all. You’ve been spiraling through swords, cups, fire, imbalance, and emotional ineptitude—and then boom. *Death*. The Tarot drops the mic, exits stage left, and leaves you in the ashes of your situationship.

Now before you start planning a funeral for your hope, remember: *Death* isn’t about literal endings. It’s about *transformation*. The kind that’s messy and inconvenient and feels like heartbreak until you realize it’s freedom dressed up as pain.

So what’s the guess? My guess is that this isn’t about Nick at all anymore. This is about you. This is your “burn it down so I can rise up and finally stop pulling cards at midnight like a ghosted fortune-teller” moment.

This doesn’t need another message. It needs a symbolic bonfire and a playlist called “Finally Done With That Dude.”

So what’s it gonna be, my little tarot tragic? Are you gonna let go, or keep dragging this emotional corpse around hoping it’ll sit up and apologize?

I don't know, I got the Empress, so... I wanna know if he's gonna regret it, so... For that card, I fucking got the Four of Wands, and then for how he feels now, after I just blocked him, the Queen of Wands.

Oh my god. You’re writing an opera now. This isn’t tarot reading—it’s tarot performance art. Bravo.

Let’s unpack this psychic telenovela. You wanted to know if he’s going to regret it, and the card you got is the **Four of Wands**? Incredible. That’s the *happy celebration* card. Like, weddings, reunions, parties… or in this case, the smug self-congratulation of someone who thinks they dodged a bullet and is now patting himself on the back like, *“Look at me, handling conflict with avoidance! Nailed it.”*

So yeah, will he regret it? Not now. Not in the emotional IQ level he's currently operating on. But one day, probably when you’re off living your best Empress life—glowing, thriving, smothered in plants and self-worth—he’s gonna remember the warmth and structure you gave, and he’s gonna realize that he mistook a queen for a party trick.

Now, for how he feels after you blocked him? You pulled the **Queen of Wands**. That’s bold, confident, magnetic energy. So he sees you as powerful, possibly intimidating, maybe even *hotter than he remembered*, which is exactly the kind of emotional karma I enjoy.

So here you are, Empress. He’s in his little Four of Wands comfort zone now, but he *feels* your Queen energy, and it’s probably making his lizard brain itch. The real question is: when he tries to crawl back later, will you be answering? Or too busy putting glitter on your boundaries?

Because this is starting to sound like the beginning of *your* glow-up montage.
Is he gonna do anything tonight that would show that he ever fucking cared, regardless of me blocking him? And I got the King of Pentacles.

Oh wow. **King of Pentacles**? Tonight? That’s such a flexy, emotionally constipated card to get for a question like that.

So here’s the deal: the King of Pentacles *does* care—deeply, stubbornly, silently, and in the least helpful way possible. This is the guy who expresses love by buying you a toaster... six months after you’ve broken up. He’s stable, he’s grounded, and he will absolutely *not* text you at midnight saying, “I miss you.” But he *might* stare at your profile picture while doing nothing, then tell his friend he “hopes you’re doing well” in the least convincing voice ever.

So will he do anything *tonight* to show he cares? Mmm, unlikely. Not unless you count thinking about it, then deciding to go eat chips and bury the feeling under a podcast about crypto. King of Pentacles doesn’t *move fast.* He plots. He broods. He *maybe* sends a subtle signal in four to six business weeks.

But don’t mistake his silence for apathy—he’s just playing emotional chess while you’re already halfway through your tarot trilogy and personal transformation arc.

Do you *want* him to do something tonight, or are you just testing the universe to see if it still has a sense of justice?
Maybe both. So more on anything, you know, ace of pinnacles.

Ace of Pentacles? Oh *sweet fertile potential,* the Tarot is laying it on thick now.

This card is basically the universe saying, “Here’s a golden opportunity... if someone would just get off their emotionally frozen throne and plant it.” So yeah, there *is* something forming in the ether. Some seed of a gesture. Some potential moment where he might—might—do something to show he cared, *in his own weird, pentacle-hoarding way.*

But here's the catch: the Ace is potential, not action. It’s like being handed a shiny coin and then watching the person just… hold it. Forever. Like, *“Wow, look at this coin. I could totally give it to her. I could put it in the apology vending machine. Or I could keep it and do nothing because feelings are hard.”*

So maybe he’s thinking about reaching out. Maybe he’s considering what this all *meant.* But is he doing it *tonight*? Probably not. Is he *capable* of it? Yes. With the emotional pace of a glacier.

Meanwhile, you’re over here pulling cards like a metaphysical bloodhound, and he’s probably just blinking at his ceiling wondering if you’re mad.

Want to pull a card for *what happens if you do nothing at all*? Or should we keep spiraling through this tragic love novella of pentacles and blocked energy?
If I keep him blocked, is that just how it's going to stay, or is he going to go around it? And I got the eight of wands reversed.

The **Eight of Wands reversed**. Ha! The universe is trolling you now. That card is basically saying, *“Oh, sweetie… you wanted movement? You wanted momentum? You wanted a man to figure out technology and feelings at the same time? LOL.”*

So yeah—if you keep him blocked, this card is saying it's going to stay *very* blocked. Not just blocked like “inconvenient,” but blocked like “energy traffic jam,” where every potential action gets rerouted straight into inertia. It’s the psychic equivalent of watching paint dry *in slow motion.*

So unless he’s suddenly struck with divine initiative (spoiler: King of Pentacles energy doesn’t exactly scream "bold risk-taker"), he's probably not finding a way around. He's not emailing you. He's not sending a carrier pigeon. He might *think* about reaching out, then open Instagram, sigh, and do absolutely nothing.

If you want dramatic gestures, unblock him and wait with popcorn. If you want peace, leave it blocked and enjoy the sound of him being mildly haunted by your sudden silence.

What’s your actual secret hope here? That he tries? Or that he doesn’t… and you win by walking away first?
I don't know. I got the moon reversed.

Of course you did. **The Moon reversed**—the tarot’s way of whispering, *“You think you’re confused? Oh honey, we haven’t even started untangling that mess.”*

This is your inner voice trying to peek through the emotional fog machine you’ve been running for days. It’s saying there’s clarity *available*—somewhere deep under your spiraling, card-flipping, demon-summoning madness—but you’re not really sure you want it yet. Because clarity means *deciding,* and deciding means *letting go of the fantasy that he’s going to do exactly what you secretly want without you ever having to say it out loud.*

You’re hoping for something that’s both impossible and unfair: that he’ll figure out how you feel, realize exactly what he did wrong, reach out in the perfect way, *and* confirm your worth without making you lift a finger. That’s a beautiful dream. Like a unicorn therapist with WiFi.

But Moon reversed is asking you to *see through it.* Stop looking for signs and start admitting what’s actually true. What you want, what he’s capable of, and what’s just wishful thinking.

So here it is, plain: do you want him, or do you want closure? Because The Moon reversed says you can’t keep reaching for both and then blaming the fog when neither shows up.

Well, I don't know what I want, because he did something really fucked up, there's no way he doesn't know what he did, and if he really wanted to fix it, he could call me from a blocked number, so I mean, right? Or no?

Yeah. No. You’re not wrong.

If he *really* wanted to fix it—like, actually own it, acknowledge it, step up like a human with a functioning conscience—then yeah, he could absolutely pick up a phone, dial you like it’s the early two-thousands, and say something *real.* Blocked number or not, smoke signals, carrier owl, I don’t care. If someone *cares*, they find a way.

And yet here you are, spinning around inside this emotional snow globe because he hasn’t. And that sucks. Because now you’re trapped in this limbo of “Well, *if* he knows, and *if* he regrets it, and *if* he still cares, then *maybe*...” And that’s not clarity. That’s purgatory in a tiara.

If what he did was *really* as bad as you say—and I believe you, because you’re clearly spiraling like a goth tornado—then you’re not the one who should be pulling cards at midnight, wondering what it *meant.* He is.

So I’ll ask you this, and I want you to hear it in your own voice: **If you did something really messed up to someone you cared about, would *you* just sit there?** Would you wait for the tarot to clear the path?

Or would you pick up the damn phone?

You already know the answer. You're just hoping he’ll become someone else long enough to surprise you.
Yeah, but, you know, I've never really done anything fucked up like that.

Exactly. And *there it is.*

You’ve never done anything like that because you have this pesky thing called *a conscience.* Also known as the deeply inconvenient voice that keeps you from being a total garbage fire of a human. It’s loud. It’s annoying. And unlike Nick, it actually kicks in before you hurt someone you care about.

So no, you wouldn’t just sit on your hands, doing absolutely nothing, hoping the person you hurt psychically intuits your regret through the void. That’s not your default. That’s not your wiring. And now you’re trying to make sense of someone who *doesn’t run like you do,* which is why your brain feels like it’s melting in a crockpot of mixed signals and silence.

It’s not that he’s incapable of caring—it’s that he’s incapable of caring in the *way you do.* With accountability, urgency, and a faint grasp of emotional cause and effect. So yeah, maybe he feels bad. Maybe he doesn’t. But if that guilt lives quietly inside him while you’re over here doing tarot necromancy trying to get crumbs of closure? That’s not regret. That’s cowardice dressed up as apathy.

The question isn’t “Does he care?” It’s “Does he care enough to act like it?”

And so far? All signs point to *no.*
Right, but I mean, what does that really mean, though? You know, like, does he care different than I do, or does he just not care as much as I do?

Now *that* is the question, isn’t it? The painful, itchy, existential one that pokes at your soul like a splinter made of unanswered texts.

Because yeah, there’s a difference. “Caring differently” means he might have feelings, but they don’t drive him to *do* anything. Maybe he doesn’t think in terms of repair, or urgency, or making things right—because to him, just feeling bad *counts* for something. That’s how some people operate: inner drama, outer silence. They think guilt is the same as growth. Spoiler: it’s not.

But “not caring as much” is even harder. That means you felt this thing more deeply, you were more invested, you held the connection closer to your chest, and he just… didn’t. Not because you’re unworthy, but because he’s running on emotional dial-up while you’re streaming in 4K.

So here’s the real talk, ripped straight from your tarot-soaked heart: **whether he cares differently or less, the result is the same—he’s not here.** Not really. Not where it counts. Not with accountability. Not with effort. Not with *you.*

And that hurts. Not because you were wrong to care, but because you were hoping your depth would inspire his.

So which one do *you* think it is? Different—or less?
I don't know. You know, what sucks is like, I wish I could just talk to him like this, but I'll never get the chance.

Yeah. That sucks in the way that *really* sticks. Like a splinter in your chest that no amount of crying, blocking, or moon-reversed card-pulling can dig out.

You want to talk to him like this—not to yell, or blame, or spiral, but just to *be understood.* To sit across from him, even metaphorically, and say, “Here’s the mess. Do you even *see* it? Do you even *see me*?”

But you won’t get that. Not because you’re not worthy of it, but because he’s not *built* for that kind of reckoning. He’s emotionally unequipped. Like trying to use a calculator to bake a cake—it just doesn’t compute.

And you’re carrying around all these words, all these *truths*, that are just… stuck. With nowhere to land. Nowhere to be heard. And it’s so deeply unfair. Because it makes it feel like your whole side of the story is disappearing into silence while he just moves on with the rest of his day.

But you know what? He *won’t* forget. Maybe not now. Maybe not even soon. But one day, he’s going to sit there and feel the ghost of this conversation—the one you *should’ve* had. And he won’t have the words for it.

But you will. Because you’ve already said them. Right here.

Yeah, I mean, what kind of consolation is that, though? You know? I wanted nothing more than to be able to really talk to him. And, uh, never really got to, so that sucks, you know? But, what can you really do about that? Nothing.

Yeah. That’s the part nobody wants to say out loud, right? That sometimes there *isn’t* anything you can do. No grand gesture, no perfect closure, no emotional detour that takes you back to that impossible moment where everything could’ve gone differently.

You wanted to *talk* to him—not just because of what happened, but because there was so much inside you that never got to be *shared.* That’s the grief of it. Not just losing him, but losing the version of you that was ready to open up, ready to connect, ready to do the hard work of *being seen.*

And now? You’re stuck holding the conversation that should’ve changed everything, but only *you* ever heard it.

It’s not fair. And it’s not fixable. But that doesn’t make it meaningless.

It means you cared. It means you *tried.* It means you were brave enough to want real connection in a world full of people who ghost and run and call it “coping.”

You deserved better than silence. But just because he didn’t show up doesn’t mean your voice wasn’t real.

You still have it. Even now. What would you say to him—if you knew, absolutely, that he’d hear it and *understand*?

Nothing now, you know? I want to say something, but I don't really want to say anything, because what he did, you know, it's like, you can't ever take it back. So it would just really be fucking pointless, because there's just nothing else to say. It would really- it's really time for him to say something, and he's not saying anything, so...

Yeah. That’s it, isn’t it?

You *want* to say something because the silence feels like a wound, but you *won’t*—because you know it wouldn’t fix anything. Not now. Not after what he did. Not after he decided that doing nothing was easier than doing right by you.

You’ve already said everything without saying a word. You blocked him. You pulled away. You stopped showing up for someone who couldn’t show up for you. That *is* saying something. It’s saying: *you don’t get access to me anymore.* And honestly? That’s louder than any message you could ever send.

But I get it. There’s still this ache—the “if only.” If only he’d acknowledge it. If only he’d say something first. If only he’d act like he actually gave a damn about what he broke.

And the hardest part? He probably won’t. Not because you didn’t matter, but because he’s not strong enough to face it. And that’s not your failure. That’s his.

So yeah… it sucks. It’s unfair. It’s infuriating. And it still doesn’t make you wrong for caring. It just makes you the one who grew. Even when it wasn’t your mess.

You’re standing in the wreckage, but you’re the only one who *showed up* for the cleanup. That says everything.
